thread.title: Michelle Keegan mocked Lauren Goodger and Mark Wright's "cringe" relationship - four years before they tied the knot
thread.title_full: Michelle Keegan mocked Lauren Goodger and Mark Wright's "cringe" relationship - four years before they tied the knot

author: Zoe Shenton
title: Michelle Keegan mocked Lauren Goodger and Mark Wright's "cringe" relationship - four years before they tied the knot
text:
Michelle once penned a column about their romance Share Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Michelle Keegan once slammed Lauren Goodger for taking back her now-husband Mark Wright. 
The actress and former TOWIE star are now madly in love, but four years before they said 'I do', Michelle didn't have quite the same opinion of her man or his then-girlfriend. 
A newly-surfaced column Michelle wrote for Love It! magazine back in 2011, obtained by Mail Online, includes a few interesting quotes about TOWIE babe Lauren, who is now happily loved up with Joey Morrison. The pair were together on and off for 10 years Mark called off the engagement five months after proposing 
"I love TOWIE! It's one of those shows you don't want to watch, but just can't help turning on," she wrote. 
"I don't know how Lauren can take Mark back so easily, though - it's so cringe!" 
She also said she'd never be able to take someone back after they'd gone behind her back. The pair started dating when they were just 15 
"I wouldn't' be able to get back with someone who'd slept with lots of girls I knew, but that's just me," she continued. 
Mark and Lauren got engaged in March 2011 after dating for 10 years on and off, but the radio DJ called off the engagement just five months later. Mark Wright and Michelle Keegan attend the National Television Awards on January 25, 2017 in London (Photo: Getty Images Europe) (Photo: Instagram/Michelle Keegan) 
Mark and Michelle tied the knot in 2015, and while Michelle has always kept a dignified silence when it comes to Lauren, Mark caused a stir when he decided to take one last swipe at his ex after she appeared to share a message aimed at him. 
She wrote: "She's the kind of girl a guy meets when he's too young and he f**ks up because there's too much living to do. But later he realises she's perfect." 
And Mark fired back on Twitter: "If your reading this, please PLEASE respect my wife and STOP. I wish you well but leave me, my life and my wife out of it. Im sure there is other ways to make money." Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
